lines.gurmukhi: qruvru igry pwq bhuro n jory jwq AYso qwq mwq suq BRwq moh mwXw ko
lines.transliteration_english: Taruvaru Giray Paat Bahuro N Joray Jaata , Aiso Taat Maat Sout Bhraat Moh Maayaa Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as leaves broken from the branches of a tree cannot be re-attached, similarly; father, mother, son, brother are relations that came into being due to chance of previous births. Like the leaves of a tree they will not re-unite again. None of these wil

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy budbudw Erw pyKq iblwie jwie AYso jwn qRXwghu Brosy BRm kwXw ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Budabudaa Aoraa Paykhat Bilaai Jaai , Aiso Jaan Tyaagahu Bharosay Bhram Kaayaa Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a bubble of water and a hail perishes in no time, similarly, give up the belief and illusion that this body will stay for long or forever.

lines.gurmukhi: qiRx kI Agin jir bUJq nbwr lwgY AYsI Awvw AOiD jYsy nyhu dRum CwXw ko
lines.transliteration_english: Trin Kee Agani Jari Boojhat Nabaar Laagai , Aisee Aavaa Audhi Jaisay Nayhu Droum Chhaayaa Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The fire of hay takes no time to extinguish, and just as developing attachment with the shade of a tree is futile, so is the period of our life. Loving it is worthless.

lines.gurmukhi: jnm jIvn AMqkwl ky sMgwqI rwchu sPl AOsr jg qb hI qau AwieAw ko ]592]
lines.transliteration_english: Janam Jeevan Antakaal Kay Sangaatee Raachahu , Sadhal Aousar Jag Tab Hee Tau Aaiaa Ko ?592?

Shabad OS B.translation: Therefore, absorb yourself in the Naam of the True Lord throughout your life-span since this is the only asset that will go with you and is the companion for ever. Only then should you consider your birth in this world a success.
